meanings.definition: An estimate that is too low.
meanings.sent1: Many people make underestimations of how long a project will take.
meanings.sent2: His underestimations of the opponent's strength led to his defeat.
meanings.sent3: The underestimations of the storm's power left many unprepared.
meanings.sent4: Her underestimations of her own abilities held her back from success.
meanings.sent5: The underestimations of the cost resulted in a budget shortfall.

meanings.definition: The act of estimating something as being smaller or less important than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: The underestimations of the impact of his words caused unintended consequences.
meanings.sent2: Never make underestimations of the value of kindness.
meanings.sent3: The underestimations of the puppy's energy level led to chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her underestimations of the situation made her miss out on a great opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The underestimations of the problem's complexity delayed finding a solution.
